task_summary: Place the already-held white box onto the tableâ€™s right-side pad and release, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator operates above a small tabletop with several bottles/cans and a small white box near the right edge. The goal is to position the end-effector over the intended place area, gently lower until contact with the table, place the white box, open the gripper to release, and back away without disturbing nearby objects. The sequence assumes the box is already grasped at the start and prioritizes collision-free, low-force placement on the right-side pad.
preconditions: Robot has the white_box securely grasped
Target place area (place_pad) is visible and reachable
Workspace is clear of dynamic obstacles
stepwise_plan: Detect or confirm the place area (place_pad)
Verify the object is in the gripper
Move above the placement spot with a small vertical offset
Lower until gentle contact with table is detected
Execute place down action for the white_box
Retreat straight back by a short distance
success_criteria: White box is resting stably on the table within the place area
Gripper fully released and robot retreated to a safe standoff
failure_and_recovery: If place area not detected, rescan or adjust viewpoint
If contact not detected within depth limit, retry lower with slightly increased depth
If release fails, reopen gripper and perform a slight lift-replace cycle
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release and retreat to the specified distance

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Confirm visibility of the placement area before approach.
Ensure the robot is already holding the white box.
Move to a pre-place hover above the target.
Descend carefully until contact with the table is detected.
Execute the place down of the held white box.
Release the object by opening the gripper.
Back away to a safe standoff after placement.

failure_modes: No contact detected within max depth
Timeouts due to kinematic reach issues
recovery_strategy: Rescan the scene and re-detect place_pad
If not holding, abort and escalate to pick pipeline
Retry the lowering with slightly greater depth and same low force threshold
Re-open gripper and re-seat the object by a tiny lift-then-lower cycle
assumptions: The robot starts while holding the white_box, as suggested by approach and descent motions in frames
The target surface is the right-side pad/edge area on the table visible across frames
Nearby bottles/cans are obstacles but static

expected_success_criteria: Box rests flat on the surface within place_pad bounds
